p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from a report of the inwards correspondence dealt with at a meeting of the Portland Borough Council held on 6 May 1896, Portland guardian, 8 May 1896, p. 3. Thomas Henry was Town Clerk at Portland at the time.

p.seg: [From Baron Von Mueller, thanking Mr. Henry for fresh seeds of marram grass forwarded, and asking to be supplied with various specimens of seaweed found on the coast, and offering to send seeds of utilitarian plants in return for the trouble of collecting, and requesting this wish to be made known by the aid of the local papersâ€”The wish to be complied with.]
